SEARCH
Package com.example.myapplication.data.firebase

Class FirebaseEventRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.myapplication.data.firebase.FirebaseEventRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventRepository
public class FirebaseEventRepository extends Object implements EventRepository
This class is meant to handle any operations that will happen to the events in Firebase Methods in this class: joinWaitlist(...) - Allows users to join the waitlist of an event

  • Constructor Details

    • FirebaseEventRepository

      public FirebaseEventRepository()

  • Method Details

    • joinWaitlist

      public void joinWaitlist(String eventId, String uid, @Nullable Double lat, @Nullable Double lng, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      This method adds the specified users id into the waitlist of a given event. The method will update the "events" collection in the application FireStore by adding the user id (uid) into an array named "waitlist". "waitlist" is an array of user ids that are a part of the specified events waitlist. It also updates the notificationList document for the linked event with the user id.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The id of event the user wants to join
      uid - The id of the user themselves
      successListener - Callback on success
      failureListener - Callback on failure

    • leaveWaitlist

      public void leaveWaitlist(String eventId, String uid, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      This method removes the specified users id from the waitlist of a given event. The method will update the "events" collection in the application FireStore by removing the user id (uid) from an array named "waitlist". "waitlist" is an array of user ids that are a part of the specified event waitlist. Also updated the notificationList to remove the user id from the waitlist array.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The id of event the user wants to leave
      uid - The id of the user themselves
      successListener - Callback on success
      failureListener - Callback on failure

    • getAllEvents

      public void getAllEvents(FirebaseEventRepository.EventListCallback callback)
      Gets all events that are stored in the "events" collection on Firestore. Each document is converted into a UserEvent object and is returned in a list through the callback.
      Parameters:
      callback - gets the list of events or receives an error.

    • fetchEventById

      public void fetchEventById(String eventId, FirebaseEventRepository.SingleEventCallback callback)
      This method gets only one event by the event id, which matches the specified events documnet id in the "events" collection on Firestore. documents is converted into a UserEvent object and returned through the callback.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the eventId is a Firestore document ID of the specified event
      callback - receives an event or an error

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent(Context context, UserEvent event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      Creates a new event in the Firestore "events" collection as well as the QR code image. The following operations are performed by this method: - A Firestore document Id gets generated. - A QR code gets generated and saved to cloudinary database - The event objects itself gets saved to Firestore - A corresponding notificationList document is created in Firestore.
      Specified by:
      createEvent in interface EventRepository
      Parameters:
      context - application context
      event - UserEvent object that is to be created on Firestore
      onSuccess - callback triggered when successful
      onFailure - callback triggered when uncsuccessful

    • updateEvent

      public void updateEvent(String eventId, UserEvent event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      This method Updated an existing event in firestore. Other data is ovverwritten by the newly provided UserEvent object.
      Specified by:
      updateEvent in interface EventRepository
      Parameters:
      eventId - Firestore ID of the event
      event - event with updated data
      onSuccess - callback triggered when successful
      onFailure - callback triggered when unsuccessful

    • sendLotteryWinNotifications

      public void sendLotteryWinNotifications(String eventId, String eventName, List<String> winnerIds, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      This method sends a notification to all users who have won the lottery for a specified event. A document gets created in the "notifications" collection containing event details, message type, and the list of userIds that won.
      Parameters:
      eventId - Firestore ID of the event
      eventName - the name of the event
      winnerIds - list of users Ids who won
      onSuccess - callback triggered when notificaiton is successfully added
      onFailure - callback triggered on Firestore failures

    • sendLotteryLostNotifications

      public void sendLotteryLostNotifications(String eventId, String eventName, List<String> loserIds, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      This method sends a notification to all users who have lost the lottery for a specified event. A document gets created in the "notifications" collection containing event details, message type, and the list of userIds that lost.
      Parameters:
      eventId - Firestore id of the event
      eventName - the name of the event
      loserIds - list of users Ids who lost
      onSuccess - callback triggered when successful
      onFailure - callback triggered when unsuccessful

    • runLottery

      public void runLottery(String eventId, String eventName, List<String> waitlist, int numToSelect, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Integer> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      This method runs the randomized lottery among the users in the events waitlist. Up to {numToSelect} users get selected as winners, which then leads to both winners and losers getting notified. As well as updates to the "notificationList" collections to record the invited participants.
      Parameters:
      eventId - Firestore Id of the event
      eventName - the name of teh event
      waitlist - list of user ids in the waiting list
      numToSelect - number of users that will be randomly selected
      onSuccess - callback triggered when successful
      onFailure - callback triggered when unsuccessful

    • acceptInvitation

      public void acceptInvitation(String notificationId, String eventId, String userId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      Accepts the event invitation that a user receives. This method is in charge of the following: - Updates status to "accepted" - Moves the user from the invited list ot the final list - The user gets removed from the waiting list.
      Parameters:
      notificationId - Firestore id of the notificationList
      eventId - the event that the invitation is connected to
      userId - the user who accepts the invite
      onSuccess - callback triggered on a successful update
      onFailure - callback triggered on a failure

    • declineInvitation

      public void declineInvitation(String notificationId, String eventId, String userId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      Declines an event invitation for a user This method is in charge of the following: - The notification status gets updated to declined - The user gets moved from the invited list to the cancelled list - The user is removed from the waiting list
      Parameters:
      notificationId - Firestore id of the notification list
      eventId - the event that the invitation is connected to
      userId - the user who declines the invite
      onSuccess - callback triggered on a successful update
      onFailure - callback triggered on a failure

    • getWaitlistLocations

      public void getWaitlistLocations(String eventId, FirebaseEventRepository.WaitlistLocationCallback callback)

    • leaveInvitedList

      public void leaveInvitedList(String eventId, String userId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      This method removes users from the invited list for a given event The Method performs the following: - The specified notificationList document is updated to remove the user from the "invited" and "all" lists. - Finds any "lottery_win" and "lottery_lost" notifications linked to the specified event and the user, then removes those notifications.
      Parameters:
      eventId - Id of the specified event
      userId - Id of the user who is getting removed from the invited list
      onSuccess - callback triggered when all updated complete successfully
      onFailure - callback triggered on any failures from Firestore
